qas.question: What did the Grand Alliance propose as the new standard for SDTV and HDTV?
Which standard were ATSC and DVB based on?
Who created the standard for DVB-2, DVB-C, and DVB-T?
Who proposed ATSC as the new standard for SDTV and HDTV?

context: <a2_0>DVB<a2_0/> created first the standard for DVB-S digital satellite TV, DVB-C digital cable TV and DVB-T digital terrestrial TV. These broadcasting systems can be used for both SDTV and HDTV. In the US <a3_0>the Grand Alliance<a3_0/> proposed <a0_0>ATSC<a0_0/> as the new standard for SDTV and HDTV. Both ATSC and DVB were based on the <a1_0>MPEG-2<a1_0/> standard, although DVB systems may also be used to transmit video using the newer and more efficient H.264/MPEG-4 AVC compression standards. Common for all DVB standards is the use of highly efficient modulation techniques for further reducing bandwidth, and foremost for reducing receiver-hardware and antenna requirements.
